intro: Genoplesium psammophilum, commonly known as the sandplain orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale green to yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is part of the genus Genoplesium, which includes several species with similar floral structures. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
